title: Email won't send
content: Lately, I have been receiving error message "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing Server (SMTP) mail.iinet.net.au timed out. Try again." I have checked the settings and they are correct. The message will send using iinet webmail, but not with Thunderbird, so the problem appears to be with Thunderbird. These are usually emails with an attachment (even small). The sending of the email stalls aroung 35%, before the message appears. I am using version 102.13.0 (64 bit). I am using Windows 10 with ESET Security. Tried sending with without ESET protection which made no difference. Can you please help?
creator: brisboy1998

title: Recurring "all day" event end date entered is not respected when saving
content:
I don't know if this is Thunderbird's calendar behaviour or a bug. I am running TB 102.13.1 on Debian Buster/10 under GNOME. My Google calendar via the web interface does not exhibit the behaviour below.

When I create a repeating/multi-day "All day Event" and specify a date under "Repeat until", the end date specified does not have an event entry after saving the event. An event is shown for all days from the event start to the day _before_ the desired end date. I have tested that a similar time-specific repeating event does not exhibit this behaviour and the end date has an event for the desired end date.

I have tested this against my Google calDAV calendar and the default "Home" calendar and the behaviour is consistent for both.
creator: jdb144

title: imap connection timed out.
content: I was using Thunderbird and it suddenly decided to not connect to the imap server. Connection timed out. This happened while I was using Thunderbird. Server name : imap.name.net.au Port 143 User name: current email address Connection Security: STARTTLS Authentication method: Normal password. I have tried reducing the number of connection, changing port number. I then started my backup computer which has not been used for a couple of months and same thing happened, imap connection timed out. My backup computer is a clone of my present computer. I have reset the router. I have ifconfig/flushdns I cannot get emails on my normal email address. If you email me use pps.nbbr@gmail.com.

title: Password on ONE account not "holding"
content:
I'm using Thunderbird: 115.0.1 (64-bit) Windows 10 I have four different email accounts and have been using Tbird for years- no problems.

Last week, ONE account is having password issues. When it starts up, it will pull mail for all the accounts without issue. I can send email on all accounts with no problems.

But once I'm on the "check email every xx minutes", everytime, this one email account prompts me THREE times for the password.

If I click to check messages manually on that account, it pulls email with no issues. I downloaded and installed this latest version and it didn't fix the issue.
creator: grantwholmes

title: Navigating spaces in the same tab
content:
Hello community,

I'm not sure if it's just me but isn't it a bit redundant to have the spaces toolbar and tabs? I actually like the spaces toolbar and would like to use it to navigate through my main spaces (mail, calendar, address book). Ideally, when I want to change the space, e. g. from Mail to Calendar, the currently open tab should be reused. Otherwise I don't get the purpose of the spaces toolbar. If all spaces are opened in a new tab then I can use the tabs to switch between the space and the spaces toolbar gets useless.

In my opinion it would be nice to have an option to open spaces selected in the spaces toolbar in the current tab. In my case I would usually have just one tab open which is fortunately hidden and the layout is nice and clean.

Or is there already such an option.

Many thanks eyght
creator: eyght

title: How do I get all of my folders and subfolders to have the same columns in v115?
content:
I just want all of my folders and sub-folders to have the same display columns! With 115, you can change any folder or sub-folder to any column organization you want, but I want them all the same. 115 changed my display columns - why couldn't you leave them alone, Thunderbird??? I can go in and change them back manually, so why were they changed at all??? I don't want to have to change each folder and its child folders individually - I have a few dozen folders, most with dozens of sub-folders. I tried the "Apply columns to ..." and selected Local Folders to change them all - none of them changed! I saw the video from Castellani claiming that TB tried to make sure that upgrading wouldn't take hours to reconfigure back to a usable state, but that's obviously not true if you have more than the one or two folders shown in the video.

Mozilla/Thunderbird -- Is it so hard to leave things as they are and just TELL us there are new features available, if we want them, instead of DESTROYING our well-used setups and forcing us to come here in hopes that someone can save us from hours of tedium just to be productive again?

Thanks to anyone who can save those of us who just want our setups back the way they were!
creator: d.stroup

title: Błąd Thunderbird - długie ściąganie emaili, brak nowych od 29.07
content:
Dzień dobry,

od kilku dni borykam się z problemem poczty teścia - ma pocztę na onecie i korzysta z thunderbird.

Od 29.07 nie przychodzą mu nowe emaile, program strasznie wolno chodzi. Po zalogowaniu się na onet przez przeglądarkę widać, że tam nowe emaile dochodzą normalnie. Próbowałem opcji "napraw", emaile ściągały się kilka godzin a i tak ściągnęły się te do 29.07. Cały czas w zasadzie trwa jakieś pobieranie.

Zainstalowałem Thunderbirda na swoim komputerze, aby sprawdzić czy problem nie pojawia się tylko na jego komputerze. Niestety gdy zalogowałem się na jego konto na moim komputerze jest dokładnie taka sama sytuacja. Dodałem 2 inne konta email, aby sprawdzić czy to się powtórzy (jedno Gmail jedno Onet - inny email). Te konta email pracują prawidłowo.

będę wdzięczny za pomoc.

title: SMTP kiszolgáló
content: Üdv! Nem tudok levelet küldeni egyik postafiókomból sem. Annyi történt, hogy 10 napra elutaztam és lekapcsoltam a számítógépet. Most csak fogadni tudok, küldeni nem. Ezt a hibaüzenetet kapom: Az üzenet küldése sikertelen. Az üzenet küldése sikertelen, mert nem lehetett kapcsolatot teremteni a levélküldő (SMTP) kiszolgálóval (mail.t-online.hu). A kiszolgáló elérhetetlen, vagy visszautasítja az SMTP kapcsolatokat. Ellenőrizze, hogy a levélküldő (SMTP) kiszolgáló beállításai helyesek-e, és próbálja meg újra. Több különböző fiókom van, de mindegyikhez ugyanezt az üzenetet kapom. Köszönettel: Attila
creator: senju1049

title: Getting inbox copied to Local Folders - Unable to set path error
content:
Hi,

In Thunderbird (fresh install of 115.01) on Win 10,

I'm trying to set my (pop) Server Settings Local Directory to:

C:\Thunderbird\Profiles\rxd7d4d1.default\Mail\Local Folders

that is where years of my prior emails are stored. I can see them in the Local Folders.

I'm just trying to make my Verizon mail save locally into that location also.

However, I get the error:

The Local Directory path "C:\Thunderbird\Profiles\rxd7d4d1.default\Mail\Local Folders" is not suitable for message storage. Please choose another directory.

Why exactly is Thunderbird choking on that path? What can I do about it?

This is the path where all my history is stored. I moved there from the Appdata/Roaming area, which has the same problem!

Many thanks to anyone who can provide a precise answer!
